name: Black Lives Matter
description: A decentralized political and social movement advocating for non-violent civil disobedience in protest against incidents of police brutality and all racially motivated violence against Black people.

name: Democratic Socialists of America (DSA)
description: A democratic socialist organization that seeks to enact progressive change through political action and activism, advocating for policies such as Medicare for All and a Green New Deal.

name: Extinction Rebellion
description: An international movement that uses non-violent civil disobedience to demand government action on climate change and biodiversity loss.

name: Anarchist Black Cross Federation
description: A collective focused on supporting political prisoners and prisoners of war through solidarity campaigns, financial aid, and advocacy for prison abolition.

name: Food Not Bombs
description: A loose-knit group of independent collectives that serve free vegan and vegetarian food to people in need, while also protesting war and poverty.

name: Sunrise Movement
description: A youth-led movement advocating for political action on climate change and championing the Green New Deal as a solution to environmental and economic crises.

name: Industrial Workers of the World (IWW)
description: A global labor union that promotes the solidarity of the working class and aims to abolish the wage system, replacing it with a system of worker self-management.

name: Queer Liberation Front
description: An activist group working to combat discrimination and violence against LGBTQ+ individuals, advocating for equal rights and representation.

name: Indigenous Environmental Network
description: A coalition of Indigenous peoples dedicated to protecting the environment and promoting Indigenous rights, particularly in relation to issues such as climate change and resource extraction.

name: Copwatch
description: A decentralized network of activist organizations and individuals that monitors and documents police activity, aiming to hold law enforcement accountable for abuses of power and brutality.

name: Marxist Student Federation
description: A student organization that educates and organizes around Marxist theory and principles, advocating for social and economic justice through revolutionary change.

name: Symbiosis
description: A network of grassroots organizations and individuals working towards a democratic and ecologically sustainable society, based on principles of mutual aid and decentralized governance.

name: Women's Strike Assembly
description: A feminist movement that organizes strikes, protests, and actions to challenge patriarchy, capitalism, and other systems of oppression.

name: Anti-Imperialist Action
description: A coalition of activists and organizations dedicated to opposing imperialism and colonialism, particularly in the context of US foreign policy and military interventions.

name: People's Climate Movement
description: A coalition of environmental, labor, and social justice organizations advocating for policies to address climate change while promoting economic and racial justice.

name: Federation of Southern Cooperatives
description: A cooperative federation that supports Black farmers and rural communities in the southern United States, promoting sustainable agriculture and economic empowerment.

name: Democratic Confederalism Collective
description: An organization inspired by the ideology of democratic confederalism, advocating for decentralized, participatory democracy and gender equality in Rojava and beyond.

name: Redneck Revolt
description: An armed left-wing group that provides firearms training and community defense, while also advocating for social justice, anti-racism, and anti-capitalism.

name: National Alliance Against Racist and Political Repression
description: An organization that fights against racist and political repression, advocates for the rights of prisoners and communities of color, and campaigns for police accountability.

name: Participatory Budgeting Project
description: An organization that promotes participatory budgeting as a democratic process that allows community members to decide how to allocate public funds.

name: Revolutionary Abolitionist Movement
description: A political movement dedicated to the abolition of capitalism and the state, while also supporting prison abolition, community defense, and solidarity with Indigenous struggles.

name: Transgender Law Center
description: An organization that works to change law, policy, and attitudes so that all people can live safely, authentically, and free from discrimination regardless of their gender identity or expression.

name: Anti-Eviction Mapping Project
description: A collective that documents and resists the displacement of marginalized communities through direct action, mapping, and community organizing.

name: National Domestic Workers Alliance
description: An organization that advocates for the rights and dignity of domestic workers, including nannies, house cleaners, and caregivers, through organizing and policy advocacy.

name: Anarcho-Syndicalist Federation
description: A federation of labor unions and workers' organizations that promote anarcho-syndicalism, a form of anarchism that seeks to organize society along decentralized, worker-controlled lines.

name: The Red Nation
description: A coalition of Native and non-Native activists dedicated to the liberation of Indigenous peoples from colonialism and capitalism, advocating for land back and Indigenous sovereignty.

name: Greenpeace
description: An environmental organization that campaigns for solutions to global environmental problems such as climate change, deforestation, overfishing, and genetic engineering.

name: Cooperation Jackson
description: An organization based in Jackson, Mississippi, that promotes economic democracy and community ownership through initiatives such as worker cooperatives and community land trusts.

name: Cosecha
description: A movement fighting for the rights and dignity of immigrants in the United States, advocating for permanent protection, dignity, and respect for all immigrants.

name: Just Transition Alliance
description: An organization advocating for a just transition to a sustainable economy that protects workers, communities, and the environment, particularly in marginalized and frontline communities.

name: American Indian Movement (AIM)
description: An Indigenous rights movement advocating for sovereignty, self-determination, and cultural preservation, while also addressing issues such as police brutality and environmental racism.

name: Street Medics
description: Volunteer medical professionals and allies who provide first aid and medical care at protests and direct actions, prioritizing the health and safety of activists and communities.

name: Democratic Autonomy Collective
description: An organization promoting democratic autonomy and self-governance in Kurdish regions and beyond, inspired by the principles of democratic confederalism.

name: National Nurses United
description: A union of registered nurses in the United States that advocates for healthcare as a human right, safe staffing ratios, and improved working conditions for nurses.

name: United We Dream
description: A youth-led immigrant rights organization that advocates for the rights of undocumented immigrants and their families, while also promoting education and leadership development.

name: Earth First!
description: A radical environmental advocacy group that employs direct action tactics to protect wilderness areas and challenge corporate and government exploitation of natural resources.

name: Red Guards - Los Angeles
description: A Maoist collective organizing in Los Angeles that advocates for revolutionary socialism and anti-imperialism, while also providing community support and mutual aid.

name: National Coalition to Abolish the Death Penalty
description: An organization dedicated to ending the death penalty in the United States through advocacy, education, and organizing.

name: Anarcha-Feminist Collective
description: A feminist group that combines anarchist and feminist principles, advocating for gender equality, reproductive rights, and the dismantling of patriarchal structures.

name: Dream Defenders
description: An organization led by Black and Brown youth fighting for justice and liberation, with a focus on ending the prison-industrial complex, police brutality, and systemic racism.

name: Free Software Foundation
description: An organization dedicated to promoting computer user freedom and defending the rights of all software users, particularly through the development and distribution of free software.

name: Center for Economic Democracy
description: An organization working to build community wealth and economic democracy through initiatives such as worker cooperatives, community land trusts, and participatory budgeting.

name: Migrant Justice
description: An organization led by undocumented migrant farmworkers fighting for justice and human rights in Vermont's dairy industry, advocating for fair wages, housing, and working conditions.

name: Earth Liberation Front (ELF)
description: A decentralized environmental direct action group that engages in sabotage and property destruction to protest against environmental destruction and speciesism.

name: National LGBTQ Task Force
description: An organization working to advance full freedom, justice, and equality for LGBTQ+ people, focusing on policy advocacy, organizing, and leadership development.

name: Fight for 15
description: A movement advocating for a $15 minimum wage and the right to unionize for low-wage workers, particularly in the fast food and retail industries.

name: Survival International
description: An organization advocating for the rights of Indigenous peoples around the world, focusing on issues such as land rights, cultural survival, and self-determination.

name: Communist Party USA
description: A communist political party in the United States that advocates for socialism, workers' rights, and social justice through electoral and grassroots organizing.

name: BYP100 (Black Youth Project 100)
description: An organization of young Black activists dedicated to creating justice and freedom for all Black people, with a focus on ending systems of oppression and violence.

name: Student Nonviolent Coordinating Committee (SNCC)
description: A civil rights organization that played a central role in the American civil rights movement, organizing nonviolent protests and advocating for racial justice and equality.

name: Community to Community Development
description: An organization working for social, economic, and environmental justice through grassroots organizing, community-based alternatives, and solidarity with global struggles.

name: Anarchist Federation
description: A federation of anarchist groups and individuals that promotes anarchist principles such as direct action, mutual aid, and solidarity, while opposing all forms of hierarchy and domination.

name: Stop the War Coalition
description: A coalition of anti-war groups and individuals that opposes military intervention and imperialism, advocating for peace, diplomacy, and disarmament.

name: Iraq Veterans Against the War
description: An organization of military veterans who have served in the US military since September 11, 2001, advocating for an end to US wars and militarism, and supporting GI rights and veteran care.

name: Communities United for Police Reform
description: A coalition of community organizations and individuals advocating for systemic changes to the NYPD and an end to discriminatory policing practices such as stop-and-frisk.

name: Anti-Fascist Action
description: A decentralized movement opposing fascism and far-right ideologies through direct action, community organizing, and self-defense.

name: Refugee Solidarity Network
description: An organization fostering community and support for refugees through food, conversation, and solidarity efforts, advocating against immigration restrictions.
